item.title: Guess Who's Ruined the Economy | Daily Best of November 4 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Democrats go into full panic mode as the midterms draw nearer. They make claims that Republicans kill you like Raid kills cockroaches, they will murder your children, ruin the economy and destroy democracy. Guess which party actually has a track record of ruining the economy, pressuring big tech to squash legitimate news stories, and killing (unborn) children. Come on, guess! In other news, TV Producer Adler has bad news for Bubba regarding their trip to see NASA's Artemis rocket launch. item.title: Lions, Riots & Lies, Oh My! | Daily Best of November 3 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Lions escape from an Australian zoo while children are having a sleepover. Luckily, no one was hurt, except for the people listening to us attempt an Australian accent. Joe Biden's primetime speech fails to mention inflation, gas prices, crime or education, but is filled with plenty of gaslighting when it comes to which party supports rioting and which supports the rule of law. Bill Clinton, Joy Behar and actress Jenifer Lewis all join in on the gaslighting fun. Elon Musk gets into a Twitter scuffle with AOC. And, we look at footage of a gigantic Shoebill stork and we absolutely are terrified. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Men Need Hobbies / We Blow Leaves / Biden Blows Smoke | Daily Best of November 2 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Men need hobbies for better mental health and we try to help Greg find a hobby besides being a grump. What is the proper etiquette for blowing leaves? Is 8am too early to wake up the neighborhood with your blower? Speaking of blowing, Joe Biden blows smoke while stumping for democrats before the upcoming midterms. Israel looks like it may re-elect Benjamin Netanyahu, meanwhile Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro hasn't conceded defeat in Sunday's pivotal election. item.title: Halloween Recap, QR Codes in China & Coach Harsin Fired | Daily Best of November 1 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We recap our Halloween festivities and decide there's nothing cuter than a toddler dressed as Elvis. China's authoritarian government gets even spookier, as it forces the Chinese people to scan QR codes to access transportation, food, and even their homes. Auburn's head football coach, Bryan Harsin, is fired mid-season after going 3 for 5. And we suggest women's soccer should allow fighting between the players, kinda like hockey, to increase viewership. Sponsor: Allegiance Gold - We recommend you diversify with Gold & Silver. item.title: Mixing Politics & Entertainment | Daily Best of October 31 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Country star Luke Bryan comes under fire for having the audacity to bring Gov. Ron DeSantis onstage during a concert that raised awareness and a ton of cash for hurricane victims in Florida. Joe Biden votes with his granddaughter and makes us all incredibly uncomfortable. Paul Pelosi is attacked in his home, but the facts of the story are about as clear as mud. NASCAR driver Ross Chastain pulled off an unbelievable maneuver that's only been seen in video games. And Jerry Lee Lewis passes away at the age of 13 — correction, that was the age of his first wife. item.title: Twitter Execs Given The Boot | Daily Best of October 28 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Elon Musk fires multiple high-ranking employees at Twitter, but don't feel bad for them because they repeatedly silenced any voices that disagreed, plus they will receive huge payouts on their wayouts. Biden claims "the most common price of gas in America is $3.39, down from over $5 when [he] took office." Gas was actually $2.39 when he took office. Fetterman's campaign says it's "ableism" to point out his inability to communicate. And, we are so sorry, but nothing is going to happen to Hunter Biden and no one will be held accountable for burying that story. item.title: Elon Enters Twitter HQ: Let That Sink In | Daily Best of October 27 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Elon Musk carries an actual sink into the headquarters of Twitter. Joe Biden says that airline fees for more legroom have a greater impact on people of color. Kamala Harris doubles down on her love of school buses, then says they are a serious problem and affect children's ability to learn. Democrat Governors Gretchen Whitmer and Kathy Hochul both take major Ls during their debates. And we all decide that people shouldn't dress their children as Jeffrey Dahmer for Halloween. Sponsor: Bank On Yourself: We've been brainwashed into believing the only way to grow our money for retirement is to risk it in the stock market. Not true. You can reach your financial goals and dreams without taking any unnecessary risks. Do you really control your retirement money? If you’ve got a 401(k) or IRA or similar retirement plan, the government controls it. They decide how much you can borrow and when you must pay it back, and you’ll owe taxes and penalties for taking money out too soon or waiting too long – even though it’s YOUR money. And thanks to our skyrocketing national debt and a Congress that continues to spend like a drunken sailor, who knows how much you’ll have to pay in taxes during a retirement that could last 30 years? Bank On Yourself is a better way to grow and protect your hard-earned money. This retirement plan alternative has never had a losing year in over 160 years! You can get a FREE report with all the details on how the Bank On Yourself strategy adds guarantees, predictability and control to your financial plan. Go to https://BankOnYourself.com. item.title: Vax Mandate Shot Down | Guests: Tommy Tuberville & Dinesh D'Souza | Daily Best of October 26 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: A New York judge ruled that NYC workers who were fired for failing to comply with the city’s COVID vaccine mandate must be rehired and receive back pay. We recap the Pennsylvania Senate candidate debate, and John Fetterman doesn't come off great. Democrat Charlie Christ tries to label Ron DeSantis as a "lockdown guy." We'd like to remind everyone that DeSantis is famous for keeping Florida, and subsequently the country, free during the COVID lockdowns. Senator Tommy Tuberville calls us and weighs in on the total lack of leadership from the Biden administration. And Dinesh D'Souza joins the program to share wisdom on securing future elections. item.title: Biden Gets Lost Again and a Head Coach Tackles His Assistant Coach | Daily Best of October 25 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: A Dothan, Alabama, head football coach tackles his own volunteer assistant coach when the team gets a yellow flag for being on the field. The story gets worse as we figure out the nature of the situation. Has anyone seen "Radio" with Cuba Gooding Jr.? In politics, Joe Biden gets lost on his own lawn, then calls Kamala Harris "the president" and a "black Indian." James Corden finally apologizes for his restaurant rant. And Taylor Swift tries to tackle the subject of female body image, but is accused by the Sensitive Left of being "fatphobic." Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Whole Show is Sick & Doctors Don't Know What They Are Talking About | Daily Best of October 24 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
The entire show is sick. Bubba is out. Greg is out. Rick, Speedy, Helmsey, and Adler are limping along the best that they can. Which brings us to today's main point: Doctors don't know what they are talking about. One year ago, the director of the CDC, Rochelle Walensky, who has received five COVID jabs, told us vaccinated people can't get or transmit COVID. Today, she tests positive for COVID-19. In politics, Joe Biden sits down with MSNBC and struggles to stay awake and form coherent sentences. Biden also clarifies that he supports gender-affirming surgery for minors. And, Rick has a big win over the weekend when he successfully jumps off his wife's car with barely any help. Sponsor: Allegiance Gold - We recommend you diversify with Gold & Silver. item.title: The Beauty of Small Government | Daily Best of October 19 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: People are able to maximize their potential when the government stays small and stays out of their lives. Joe Biden continues his daily gaffe parade. Environmentalist wackos don't realize how good they have it. An Arkansas weed advocate reminds us that drugs are bad. Anna May Wong is being honored on the face of a U.S. coin, and we don't care. And, we look back at some of the sounds of the tech of our childhood. Sponsor: Reliefband is the #1 FDA-Cleared anti-nausea wristband that has been clinically proven to quickly relieve and effectively prevent nausea and vomiting associated with motion sickness, anxiety, migraines, hangovers, morning sickness, chemotherapy and so much more. Whether you need everyday nausea relief or just an occasional cure from nausea, their patented technology makes feeling sick a thing of the past. Forget the days of nausea pills that make you groggy and exhausted. It’s like the name says. Reliefband is legitimately a band you wear on your wrist to give you relief from nausea and you can change the intensity depending on how you are feeling to make it stronger or weaker. If you want the band that actually works at relieving your nausea, check out Reliefband. Right now, we’ve got an exclusive offer just for RICK & BUBBA listeners. If you go to https://reliefband.com and use promo code BUBBA you’ll receive 20% off plus free shipping and a no questions asked 30-day money back guarantee. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Tennessee Beats Bama & Biden Beats Ice Cream | Daily Best of October 17 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Tennessee defeated Alabama in a tight game that went down to a final field goal. Fans stormed the field and the goalpost ended up in the Tennessee River. In politics, Biden eats ice cream while claiming the economy is "strong as hell." Everyone's 401k begs to differ. The man who killed six people when he drove his car through the Wakesha parade choose to defend himself in court and we wish Wisconsin had the death penalty. Herschel Walker and Raphael Warnock face off over abortion and the economy in their only Senate debate. And, 81-year-old billionaire Robert Kraft married 47-year-old Dana Blumberg in a star-studded surprise wedding. item.title: Not Everything Is About Race & Drag Shows Can't Be 'Family-Friendly' | Daily Best of October 14 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Reporters are stunned when Tampa Bay head coach Todd Bowles doesn't allow the press to make the matchup about race as he prepares to take on Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin. A mom speaks some common sense at a town hall meeting as she states there's no such thing as a "family-friendly" drag show. Rural residents of Oregon are fed up with the entire western half of the state and look to join Idaho. Things get awkward on "The View" as Whoopi's former co-star finds out she won't be in "Sister Act 3." Reporters are stunned when Tampa Bay head coach Todd Bowles doesn't allow the press to make the matchup about race as he prepares to take on Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin. A mom speaks some common sense at a town hall meeting as she states there's no such thing as a "family-friendly" drag show. Rural residents of Oregon are fed up with the entire western half of the state and look to join Idaho. Things get awkward on "The View" as Whoopi's former co-star finds out she won't be in "Sister Act 3." And, the Alabama-Tennessee game this weekend actually matters for the first time since before the iPhone came out.

item.title: Passive-Aggressive Emojis & Vax Discrimination | Daily Best of October 12 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We look back at the insane level of discrimination that was perpetuated across the globe against people who didn't want to get the COVID vaccine and the false information that was spread about the efficacy against infection and transmission. Gen Z declares some emojis like the "thumbs up" to be passive-aggressive. Jake Tapper interviews Joe Biden about Hunter, but doesn't ask any questions that could incriminate Joe. We flash back to 1992, when Rush Limbaugh calls out Al Gore for being alarmist about the fate of the globe. And, TV Producer Adler gets in a fight with a lady at the beach. item.title: The Overwhelming Evidence of God | Daily Best of October 10 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: On his trip to the edge of space on "Blue Origin," William Shatner is confronted with the emptiness of space and the beauty of Earth, but unfortunately he misses the point. The war in Ukraine is getting scarier by the day. In sports, college football is heating up, and we look at last weekend's games and the upcoming matchups. Tom Brady gets a monumental "roughing the passer" call in his favor. Speaking of football, concussion protocol has changed over the years, and Greg recounts all the times he got his "bell rung." (It was just concussions.) And lastly, Rick gives a telemarketer a taste of his own medicine. item.description: Joe Biden is caught on a hot mic dropping an F-bomb while speaking to a Florida mayor, and he sounds more like a member of the mob than the president of the United States. Tom Brady and Gisele look like they are getting divorced. Velma from "Scooby-Doo" is a lesbian. And lastly, a caller asks us for advice on how a man should hug another man. item.title: Equity Is Impossible & God Doesn't Play Favorites | Daily Best of October 5 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: When Christians encounter tragedy and hardship, how they respond should point people to Christ. That's the reason for suffering in this world. In the wake of Bubba's amazing cancer recovery, we ask how Christians should react, in good times and bad. In politics, Vice President Kamala Harris continues to push "equity" as the answer, while in reality, it's impossible and just poorly-veiled Communism. In sports, Aaron Judge breaks the American League home run record. And the movie "Bros" was complete flop and we can't imagine why?!?! item.title: Loretta Lynn: Farewell to the Coal Miner's Daughter | Daily Best of October 4 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: The First Lady of Country Music, Loretta Lynn, passed away at the age of 90. She was a symbol of the fortitude and value of the working class and the resilience of rural America. Today we remember "The Coal Miner's Daughter." In sports, Albert Pujols breaks Babe Ruth's home run record. Alabama head coach Nick Saban prepares for this weekend's matchup against Jimbo Fisher and Texas A&M. In politics, Ron DeSantis masterfully and truthfully defends Florida's preparation for and response to Hurricane Ian. And lastly, Joe Biden says he was "sort of raised in the Puerto Rican community at home, politically." Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Talladega Rocks & Tesla Bots | Daily Best of October 3 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Record numbers of fans turn out to Talladega for the big race. Some fans might just have been fleeing a hurricane, but at least they had a good time. Speaking of the hurricane, Gov. Ron DeSantis reminds potential looters that Florida is a Second Amendment state. Tesla reveals its prototype Tesla Bot, and it gives us an uneasy feeling. Greg recaps his not-so-great time in his 5K run for cancer. And speaking of, Bubba shares more good news regarding his recovery from liver cancer surgery. Sponsors: EdenPURE is a leading national developer and supplier of breakthrough healthy home appliances and goods designed to save consumers money on their monthly budgets, make life’s tasks easier and improve healthy living conditions. You can purify the air in your home and get healthy, clean, fresh smelling air, eliminate odors, kill mold & mildew and bacteria & viruses. It does not mask or cover up bad odors and pollutants, it eliminates them. item.title: Hurricane Ian Slams Florida | Daily Best of September 30 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We look at the impact of Hurricane Ian after the storm decimated Ft. Myers and other areas. Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa suffers a major head and neck injury that left him unconscious and seemingly frozen with his hands in front of his face. Tua has been released from the hospital and is able to feel and move all his limbs, but it's not a good look for the NFL as they try to avoid further CTE controversy. Trevor Noah retires from his job as host of 'The Daily Show.' And lastly, we welcome our live audience back in the studio and they bring us custom leather belts. The belts were a tight squeeze, but we appreciate the gift. Sponsor: Allegiance Gold - We recommend you diversify with Gold & Silver. item.title: Stacey Abrams Has No Heart | Daily Best of September 23 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Stacey Abrams claims that "there is no such thing as a heartbeat at six weeks. It is a manufactured sound designed to convince people that men have the right to take control of a woman's body." Wow. In other news, people keep going too far with their emotional support animals, as we take a look at a pet alligator and a lynx! And we update you on the latest as Bubba recovers after surgery to remove a tumor from his liver. Assistant Producer Greg tries to put in his contact lenses while we coach (heckle) him live on the air. Nikki Haley is accused by Sunny Hostin of "whitewashing" because she doesn't use her first name. And last but not least, we say thank you to everyone who said a prayer for Bubba during his successful liver surgery.

item.title: Greg Makes Contact | Daily Best of September 21 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Assistant Producer Greg decides to give contact lenses a try, which is going to be tough because touching his own eye doesn't seem to be an option. The FDA is six months late in warning people not to cook chicken in NyQuil. Joy Behar thinks Gavin Newsom and Stacey Abrams would make great candidates for the 2024 election. And last but not least, we say a prayer for Bubba as he goes under the knife for liver surgery. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Godspeed, Bubba! | Daily Best of September 20 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Bubba departs for surgery to remove a spot on his liver. We wish him well, then take odds on how long it will take for him to return to the show. A federal appeals court upheld a Texas law that bars large social media companies from banning or censoring users based on “viewpoint,” and we celebrate the setback for big tech and their attempts to control the narrative. We watch Post Malone and Tim McGraw take a spill during recent concert performances. David Beaman with NASA gives us an update on the historic, but delayed Artemis launch. A candidate for Utah state senate makes an attempt at a rap campaign video. And lastly, a guy wielding a hatchet and destroying a NYC McDonalds is arrested and then immediately released. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Martha's Vineyard Becomes a Border Town | Daily Best of September 16 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: It takes only 50 illegal immigrants being brought to Martha's Vineyard to bring the billionaire community to its knees. The elites want middle-class border towns to deal with mass illegal immigration, but can't handle it when it comes to their town. It's been over a decade since we've spoken to him, but we try to break down the controversy surrounding our old hunting buddy Brett Favre. An asteroid (or an alien) was captured entering the atmosphere over Scotland. And lastly, Adler's deck project is finished and we fiercely debate what type of workers should and should not receive tips. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Death of a Queen and a Restaurant | Daily Best of September 14 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We look at the immediate aftermath of Queen Elizabeth II passing. From trashing her legacy to calling for reparations, the woke media just won't stop. In other news, thousands of cups from Rick & Bubba's short-lived restaurant are turning up 20 years later on the streets of New York City. In politics, Joe Biden and his administration act like they are winning the fight against inflation and securing the border. And lastly, Bubba gives us a health update as he prepares to undergo surgery next week. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Horns Down, Toilets Up | Daily Best of September 8 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: After a surprise delivery, we may have a solution for the long walk to the bathroom at our new studios. Speaking of toilets, Bubba got some interesting features added to his home. In sports, as Alabama prepares to take on Texas this weekend, Coach Nick Saban learns it will be a 15-yard penalty if a player shows the "horns down" hand sign. In politics, Obama says the country is better off since Biden took office. And lastly, Memphis is in shock after a string of horrific shootings perpetrated by a man who was streaming it all live online. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

In sports, as Alabama prepares to take on Texas this weekend, Coach Nick Saban learns it will be a 15-yard penalty if a player shows the "horns down" hand sign. In politics, Obama says the country is better off since Biden took office. And lastly, Memphis is in shock after a string of horrific shootings perpetrated by a man who was streaming it all live online.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Football Is Back & Biden "Beats Pharma" | Daily Best of September 6 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We recap all the action as college football makes it's return. Joe Biden claims to have "beat Pharma this year." We hope the president isn't just talking about forgetting to take his medication. A Tulsa news reporter is doing fine after having a stroke while live on the air. A carnival ride in India malfunctions while people are on board. We look back at the efficacy of Ivermectin over the course of the pandemic. And lastly, Speedy went dove hunting and Greg delivered some plywood to Adler's house, then a boxing match breaks out. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Who's Worse: Joe Biden or Jimmy Carter? | Daily Best of September 1 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We try to decide who we would choose if we had to vote for either Joe Biden or Jimmy Carter. Sarah Palin lost a special election for an Alaska House seat. Deion Sanders offers some common-sense advice for his players. We show a video that proves fat people need to stay away from inversion tables. And lastly, Speedy has a "little" problem as he prepares for his role as stadium hype man for UAB football's opening game. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Mikhail Gorbachev Dies at 91 | Daily Best of August 31 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Former Soviet Union President Mikhail Gorbachev passes away at the age of 91. We look back the port-wine-stained leader's legacy weighed against the current Russian conflict. While speaking in Pennsylvania, Joe Biden struggles to endorse the correct candidate for the correct position, then follows up with inaccuracies about guns and basketball. Two men are rescued clinging to a floating cooler in Boston Harbor. And lastly, we think someone is sabotaging our bathroom. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Student loans being forgiven shines light on the real reason we are in this mess to begin with. In sports, Tom Brady tries to explain why he missed training camp and Aaron Rodgers explains how hard it was to avoid getting vaxxed. item.title: TobyMac's "Life After Death" / Taylor Hicks Performs Live | Daily Best of August 25 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: TobyMac joins us and opens up about writing songs after the death of his son and his latest release "Life After Death." American Idol alum Taylor Hicks performs live in the studio. In politics, Joe Biden makes moves to forgive $10K of student loans. This is a slap in the face to the working class that pays their debts. Bubba is still out due his gallbladder surgery, but we make an incredible discovery about the potential origin of Bubba's gallbladder woes. And lastly, an old lady fights off a fox attack. item.title: Rick's Perfect Sausage Balls | Daily Best of August 22 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Rick's wife asks for help in the kitchen and it turns out Rick is capable of making absolutely perfect sausage balls. In other news, we are beginning to think there may be something wrong with Gary Busey. Dennis Rodman says he's going to Russia to bring back Brittney Griner. The historic NASA SLS launch is less than a week away and Bubba and Adler prepare for the voyage to see it happen live. An off-duty Alabama police officer narrowly avoids being ran over in his own driveway. And lastly, an old football ref takes a spill during a game. Blaze Socks: Blaze's patriotic sock packs are back! At the end of last year, we released a limited supply of a Let's Go Brandon socks so you could wear your patriotism wherever you wanted. They were comfortable, stylish, and best of all, worth a laugh. These socks are made in America from start to finish: the materials, the production, and packaging are all 100% AMERICAN. Even the fine men and women packing and shipping these socks are Americans through and through. Go to BlazeSocks.com and get them before they're gone. Use promo code “BlazeSub” for 20% off your purchase. You must use the email address associated with your BlazeTV subscription to snag this discount as this code is only available to BlazeTV subscribers. https://blazesocks.com Learn more about your ad choices. Rick's wife asks for help in the kitchen and it turns out Rick is capable of making absolutely perfect sausage balls. In other news, we are beginning to think there may be something wrong with Gary Busey. Dennis Rodman says he's going to Russia to bring back Brittney Griner. The historic NASA SLS launch is less than a week away and Bubba and Adler prepare for the voyage to see it happen live. An off-duty Alabama police officer narrowly avoids being ran over in his own driveway. And lastly, an old football ref takes a spill during a game.

item.title: CNN Axes Brian Stelter | Daily Best of August 19 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Brian Stelter, host of the ironically-named 'Reliable Sources' show on CNN, has been fired and will be departing from the network. The new electric Dodge Charger is equipped with fake exhaust noise and we are not impressed. We debate who would win in a silverback gorilla vs. grizzly bear fight. And lastly, the latest sign of societal decline: quiet quitting.

item.title: Space Bros Are GO | Daily Best of August 18 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Bubba and Adler finalize and confirm plans to see the upcoming historic rocket launch of NASA's SLS at the actual launch site! After losing the Wyoming GOP primary in a landslide, Liz Cheney says she is thinking about running for president. The IRS is training armed agents to enter homes and make arrests. And lastly, we make plans with scientists from Skinwalker Ranch to play a frequency sound on all of our nation-wide radio affiliates and satellites to see if it triggers an alien invasion. But hopefully that doesn't happen.

This kit includes five of the most desirable silver products to invest in… including a silver American Eagle and a silver Australian Kangaroo. This offer is limited to just ONE per household, so get yours NOW! Blaze Socks: Blaze's patriotic sock packs are back! At the end of last year, we released a limited supply of a Let's Go Brandon socks so you could wear your patriotism wherever you wanted. They were comfortable, stylish, and best of all, worth a laugh. These socks are made in America from start to finish: the materials, the production, and packaging are all 100% AMERICAN. Even the fine men and women packing and shipping these socks are Americans through and through. Go to BlazeSocks.com and get them before they're gone. Use promo code “BlazeSub” for 20% off your purchase. item.title: Liz Cheney Thinks She Is Abraham Lincoln | Daily Best of August 17 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: After losing the Wyoming GOP primary in a landslide, Liz Cheney compares herself to Abraham Lincoln. Joe Biden signs the Inflation Reduction Act into law and then forgets where he is and what he's supposed to do with his hands. Bubba and Adler work on plans to see the upcoming historic rocket launch of NASA's SLS. And lastly, since some of us can't reach or even see our toes, we decide we all need to stretch more. item.title: Distrust Of Government at All-Time High: I Wonder Why? | Daily Best of August 16 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: After listing many reasons why people no longer trust the government, CNN can't figure out why people no longer trust the government. Kamala Harris educates us about space and equity. An elderly woman is tragically eaten by an alligator. An engineer creates legs for a snake. And lastly, Rick tries to help his mom with her TV channels and it doesn't go great. Sponsor: Blaze Socks: Blaze's patriotic sock packs are back! At the end of last year, we released a limited supply of a Let's Go Brandon socks so you could wear your patriotism wherever you wanted. item.title: Bubba Breakdances, Biden Just Breaks | Daily Best of August 15 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Bubba breaks it down on the dance floor at his 40th high school reunion. Biden just breaks as he struggles to speak time and time again. Climate change is being blamed for today’s children being 30% less aerobically fit than their parents were at their age, but we think kids having their own phones is more to blame. Speaking of fitness, we look at how sleep deprivation and poor diet contribute to poor health. After 30 years of snacking on the air from 5am til 10am, no wonder we are so fat! item.title: AG Garland Approved FBI Raid While Hunter Biden Rides Air Force One | Daily Best of August 12 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Attorney General Merrick Garland says he personally approved the FBI raid on Mar-a-Lago. Meanwhile, Hunter Biden is all smiles as he boards Air Force One with his dad. Marshawn Lynch is dragged from his car after being pulled over for drunk driving and refusing to obey orders from police. Field of Dreams brings back Vin Scully. We debate whether we would rather be killed by a wood chipper, impaled by a beach umbrella, or eaten by a shark. And lastly, Rick's tiny dog takes on a huge deer and things don't go great for the dog.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The F.B.I. Raids Mar-a-Lago | Daily Best of August 9 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: The FBI executed a search warrant at Trump's Mar-a-Lago mansion, reportedly even cracking the former president's safe in an attempt to find classified documents kept at the Florida estate. Meanwhile, forget rescuing the economy, Joe Biden can't even put on his own jacket. Even Bernie Sanders is admitting that the “so-called Inflation Reduction Act will, in fact, have a minimal impact on inflation.” We announce the return of The Golden Ticket Seats (our live in-studio audience.) And, we just want to mention that we love onion rings. Sponsor: BullionMax - Who else wants an easy way to stack silver? For a limited time, BullionMax is offering the World’s Most-Loved Silver at BELOW Employee Pricing. If you’d like to diversify your retirement savings with precious metals, Birch Gold is a great option. But over the past year, we’ve heard from many of you who would like to buy small increments of gold and silver OUTSIDE of a retirement account, so today, we’re excited to tell you about Bullion Max. Bullion Max will ship gold and silver in ANY denomination directly to your door, for you to hold at your home, in your own safe! Buy direct from Bullion Max’s website without talking to a salesperson, and your fully insured precious metals order is shipped directly to your home. It’s fast, it’s easy. To help you get started, we worked out a special offer with them – just for you. Get BullionMax’s Silver Starter Kit at EMPLOYEE PRICING! Just go to https://BullionMax.com/RickBubbacom. This kit includes five of the most desirable silver products to invest in… including a silver American Eagle and a silver Australian Kangaroo. This offer is limited to just ONE per household, so get yours NOW! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.description: Two things are back from past: mullets and inflation. Democrats applaud themselves while passing a bill that will raise taxes on the middle class. Rick lands in Florida for a speaking gig and encounters an amazing mullet. An Alabama veterinarian goes viral after she shares a list of dog breeds she would never own. And, Aaron Rodgers talks about doing psychedelics to improve his throwing game. item.description: Alex Jones will have to pay $4.1 million to parents of victims of Sandy Hook; however, he can at least celebrate that he was able to get in a phenomenal jab against the Clintons. item.title: 50 Years of The Marshall Tucker Band | Daily Best of August 4 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
We are joined by Doug Gray, lead singer of The Marshall Tucker Band, as he looks back on 50 years of singing for the band. Dentist Dr. Dudney is with us to show off the winner of our "Fix Momma's Mouth" contest featuring a dental makeover worth over $15,000! Alex Jones is in hot water as it's revealed his lawyers accidentally sent his phone records to the lawyers that are suing him. And, TV Producer Adler shows us the insane commercial he made advertising the sale of his motorcycle.

item.title: Vin Scully, Broken Arms & Broke Backs | Daily Best of August 3 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Vin Scully, best known for his 67 seasons calling games for the Los Angeles Dodgers, passes away at the age of 94. An 80-year-old store clerk in California shoots a would-be robber's arm to pieces, thanks to the Second Amendment. Bubba gets lost looking for his car in a parking deck. The Biden administration contradicts itself as Nancy Pelosi departs from Taiwan. And, upon hearing about an upcoming "Roadhouse" remake, we debate whether it would be worse to play Ned Beatty's character in "Deliverance" or to play Jake Gyllenhaal's in "Brokeback Mountain." Sponsor: Blaze Socks: Blaze's patriotic sock packs are back! At the end of last year, we released a limited supply of a Let's Go Brandon socks so you could wear your patriotism wherever you wanted. They were comfortable, stylish, and best of all, worth a laugh. These socks are made in America from start to finish: the materials, the production, and packaging are all 100% AMERICAN. item.description: Joe Biden announces Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri has been killed in a U.S. drone strike. Nancy Pelosi touches down and begins her controversial visit to Taiwan. Herschel Walker responds after MSNBC contributor Elie Mystal said "Herschel Walker will do what he's told and that's what Republicans want from their negroes." AOC calls a group of drag queens "patriots." And, Bubba mourns the loss of his favorite Mexican restaurant by pouring out some cheese dip. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: LIV Large: Let's Go Brandon | Daily Best of August 1 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Huge player pay-outs and chants of "Let's Go Brandon" rang out as LIV Golf hosted it's third event at Trump National Golf Club in Bedminster, N.J. last weekend. Meanwhile, Joe Biden tests positive for COVID once again. The Biden administration denies they are building the border wall, while building the border wall. Kentucky braces for more rainfall as the death toll rises to 30 due to devastating flooding. NBA legend Bill Russell passes away at the age of 88. Will Smith issues apology video for slapping Chris Rock. A 25-year-old trans cheerleader chokes a 17-year-old female cheerleader for stating the obvious. And lastly, Rick goes to a farmer's market with his entire family and, wow, it's hot. Sponsor: Blaze Socks: Blaze's patriotic sock packs are back! At the end of last year, we released a limited supply of a Let's Go Brandon socks so you could wear your patriotism wherever you wanted. They were comfortable, stylish, and best of all, worth a laugh. These socks are made in America from start to finish: the materials, the production, and packaging are all 100% AMERICAN. Even the fine men and women packing and shipping these socks are Americans through and through. item.title: Lift Your Voice, Not Your Finger | Daily Best of July 29 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Democrat Rep. Linda Sanchez gives the GOP dugout the middle finger during the congressional baseball game. We debate who is the greatest rock and roll singer of all time, and it ain't Bob Dylan. Justice Samuel Alito hilariously mocks "foreign leaders" who condemned his opinion overturning Roe v. Wade, including Boris Johnson and Prince Harry. And lastly, the Biden administration and the President himself continue to deny that we are in a recession. Sponsor: RealEstateAgentsITrust.com - Buying or selling a home is already one of the most stressful things you can do – and it can be ten times worse if you’re not working with the right agent. Generally speaking, our homes are our biggest investment – that’s a lot of responsibility, and you need an agent who can take that seriously. That’s why we recommend Real Estate Agents I Trust. We work with only the best agents in every market. We do our homework, talking to every agent before inviting them to join our network – and here’s a big one: we only work with full-time professionals…no part-time or inexperienced agents. Our team makes the introduction, and then follows you through the buying or selling process to make sure that you’re satisfied. item.title: What Is A Recession? | Daily Best of July 28 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: The Biden administration could not define the word "woman," and now they can't define the word "recession." The numbers are in, and we are definitely in a recession. Dr. Fauci claims he did not want to "lock down anything," but his own words from 2020 show that he "recommended locking down the country." NCAA swimmer Riley Gaines talks about what it was like being forced to compete against and change in a locker room with transgender swimmer Lia Thomas. And lastly, Adler announces that he and his wife are expecting their second child in 2023, but is it a boy or girl? Sponsors: BullionMax - Who else wants an easy way to stack silver? For a limited time, BullionMax is offering the World’s Most-Loved Silver at BELOW Employee Pricing. If you’d like to diversify your retirement savings with precious metals, Birch Gold is a great option. But over the past year, we’ve heard from many of you who would like to buy small increments of gold and silver OUTSIDE of a retirement account, so today, we’re excited to tell you about Bullion Max. Bullion Max will ship gold and silver in ANY denomination directly to your door, for you to hold at your home, in your own safe! Buy direct from Bullion Max’s website without talking to a salesperson, and your fully insured precious metals order is shipped directly to your home. It’s fast, it’s easy. To help you get started, we worked out a special offer with them – just for you. Get BullionMax’s Silver Starter Kit at EMPLOYEE PRICING! Just go to https://BullionMax.com/RickBubbacom. This kit includes five of the most desirable silver products to invest in… including a silver American Eagle and a silver Australian Kangaroo. This offer is limited to just ONE per household, so get yours NOW! Blaze Socks: Blaze's patriotic sock packs are back! At the end of last year, we released a limited supply of a Let's Go Brandon socks so you could wear your patriotism wherever you wanted. They were comfortable, stylish, and best of all, worth a laugh. These socks are made in America from start to finish: the materials, the production, and packaging are all 100% AMERICAN. Even the fine men and women packing and shipping these socks are Americans through and through. For you BlazeTV subscribers, we want to thank you for your continued support, so we're sweetening the pot. Use promo code “Blaze Sub” for 20% off your purchase. You must use the email address associated with your BlazeTV subscription to snag this discount. Not a subscriber? No problem! Subscribe to BlazeTV now and use promo code “BubbaSocks" to save on both your BlazeTV subscription AND get 20% off these limited-edition socks. https://blazesocks.com Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Alarming: Biden's Vacant, Unblinking Eyes | Daily Best of July 26 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Videos released by the Biden White House show two very different and concerning versions of the President. In one video Biden's eyes look soulless and unblinking and we suspect the cause to be an improper dose of drugs designed to keep the President mentally sharp. Whatever it is, it creeps us out. There's no way he makes it to another term, and Democrats know it. In other news, Aaron Rodgers showed up to training camp looking exactly like Nicolas Cage from "Con Air." Kamala Harris lets us know her preferred pronouns. Producer Speedy is mad that we aren't watching "Shark Week." And lastly, someone sets off the fire alarm while we are live on the air! item.title: The Pope Goes Native | Daily Best of July 26 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Pope Francis donned a headdress while issuing an apology after findings detailed a history of physical and sexual abuse of indigenous children in Canada's Catholic-run residential schools. In other news, we want to know who killed JonBenét and JFK. Dr. Fauci looks back at the last two years and wishes he had implemented more stringent rules. And lastly, Bubba gets ice cream from a floating ice cream truck.

item.title: That Was A Lie: The Vax Stops Infection | Daily Best of July 25 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We replay the tape showing world leaders claiming that the vaccine would stop people from getting COVID, followed by those same world leaders announcing they had been infected. A wind turbine is struck by lightning and explodes, proving God does not support "the green movement." A sinkhole opens up at the bottom of a pool and takes all the water, floaties, and a man down with it. MLB pitcher Nolan Ryan was an absolute hoss. Is Elon Musk a lizard person? And lastly, would we get a footlong tattoo if it meant free Subway sandwiches for life? item.title: Unraveling Biden's COVID Case | Daily Best of July 22 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: After lying to the American people about the efficacy of the vaccine, quadruple-vaxxed Joe Biden reassures us he's going to be okay while in isolation at the White House. CNN's Van Jones admits things have gotten worse since Biden took office. A father punches a man in court who is on trial for the murder of his son, and we don't blame the father one bit. Rick and Bubba give advice on how to raise godly daughters. And lastly, Speedy tries to help but ends up breaking Rick's microphone while we are live on the air! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Ultra-Vaxxed Biden Tests Positive | Daily Best of July 21 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: The White House announced that vaxxed and boosted Biden tests positive for COVID-19, after having to clarify that Biden does not in fact have cancer. ESPN gave an ESPY to an athlete who renounced her U.S. citizenship to complete for China at the Olympics last year. Dramatic footage shows a man narrowly escaping a wildfire as his clothes burn off in Tábara, Spain. And lastly, Bubba wants us to know that he had a "heart event" not a "heart attack." item.title: AOC Arrested With Invisible Handcuffs | Daily Best of July 20 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Democratic lawmakers including Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez were arrested during an abortion rights protest in front of the Supreme Court. While being escorted away by police, AOC and Ilhan Omar held their hands behinds their backs to make it appear as if they were handcuffed. Oh, the pageantry of it all. In sports, SEC Media days brings some incredible quotes from Nick Saban. Buzz Aldrin auctions off a jacket he wore while on mission to the moon. And lastly, we investigate an explosion at the Hoover Dam.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Good Samaritans Are Now Bad Guys? | Daily Best of July 19 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: A Good Samaritan stops a mass shooting at an Indiana mall, but the media claims he is the bad guy. Elon Musk countersues Twitter. Prince Harry lectures the common-folk during his speech at the U.N. Gavin Newsome takes aim at Ron DeSantis and claims Florida is attacking freedom, and DeSantis responds with facts. And lastly, the Biden administration wants to take credit for falling gas prices, but none of the blame for price increases. item.title: World Games 2022: That's A Wrap | Daily Best of July 18 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: The World Games came to Birmingham, Alabama, and we recap how our hometown pulled off the international sporting event. Joe Biden "fist bumps" his way through Saudi Arabia. Charles Barkley weighs in on transgenderism. Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck tie the knot during a low-key ceremony in Las Vegas. And it's Greg's birthday, so celebrate by eating cake and watching cars drive off a cliff. item.title: Biden Shakes Hands with Nobody, Again | Daily Best of July 15 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Joe Biden inexplicably shakes hands with an invisible person yet again. Ivanna Trump has passed away after what appears to be a cardiac event. The story about the 10-year-old girl caught up in the abortion debate gets even muddier as the girl's mother defends the alleged rapist. And lastly, Rick admits that he is too old to go to movies that start after 9pm. item.title: Democrats Continue Abortion Lies | Daily Best of July 13 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Joe Biden, Elizabeth Warren, AOC, and many other Democrats continue to tell flat-out lies about abortion alternatives and the medical options for women with ectopic pregnancies. Meanwhile, Senator Josh Hawley is told he is bringing violence to transgender people by simply disagreeing with the notion that men can get pregnant. Rick attends the World Games men's lacrosse championship and comes away impressed with everything except the parking situation. And lastly, we decide that we like chips and dips in large amounts and mariachi bands in small amounts.

If you’d like to diversify your retirement savings with precious metals, Birch Gold is a great option. But over the past year, we’ve heard from many of you who would like to buy small increments of gold and silver OUTSIDE of a retirement account, so today, we’re excited to tell you about Bullion Max. Bullion Max will ship gold and silver in ANY denomination directly to your door, for you to hold at your home, in your own safe! Buy direct from Bullion Max’s website without talking to a salesperson, and your fully insured precious metals order is shipped directly to your home. It’s fast, it’s easy. To help you get started, we worked out a special offer with them – just for you. Get BullionMax’s Silver Starter Kit at EMPLOYEE PRICING! Just go to https://BullionMax.com/RickBubbacom. This kit includes five of the most desirable silver products to invest in… including a silver American Eagle and a silver Australian Kangaroo. This offer is limited to just ONE per household, so get yours NOW! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: I'm Joe Biden? | Daily Best of July 11 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Just like Ron Burgundy from "Anchorman," Joe Biden will read anything they put on the teleprompter. Meanwhile, Kamala Harris can't confirm Joe Biden is running again in 2024. Sri Lankan protestors storm the presidential palace and swim in the palatial pool. The World Games are in full swing here in Birmingham, Alabama. NASA prepares to unveil brand new images from space. A 17-year-old that started puberty blockers at age 13 talks about her regret and permanent changes to her body as she tries to de-transition. And lastly, we help come up with some team names for the Women's Football Alliance.
Sponsors: Ladder - Ladder is revolutionizing an age-old industry offering term life insurance at a personalized price, that can flex as your needs change. Why not pay a bit each month to protect the ones you love? Ladder makes it impressively fast and easy to get covered. You just need a few minutes, and a phone or laptop to apply. Ladder’s smart algorithms work in real-time, so you’ll find out instantly if you’re approved. No hidden fees. Cancel any time. At Ladder, they've created a painless way to get the life insurance coverage you need for those you care about most. Check out Ladder today to see if you’re instantly approved. Go to https://ladderlife.com/bubba.
Moink - Moink delivers grass-fed and grass-finished beef and lamb, pastured pork and chicken, and wild-caught Alaskan salmon, direct to your door - helping Family Farms become financially independent outside of big agriculture.Their animals are raised outdoors, their fish swim wild in the ocean, and Moink meat is free of antibiotics, hormones, sugar, and all the other junk you find pre-packaged in the meat aisle. Sign up at https://MoinkBox.com/BUBBA to get a Year of Bacon for FREE and then pick what meats you want delivered with your first box. Change what you get each month and cancel anytime.
RealEstateAgentsITrust.com - Buying or selling a home is already one of the most stressful things you can do – and it can be ten times worse if you’re not working with the right agent. Generally speaking, our homes are our biggest investment – that’s a lot of responsibility, and you need an agent who can take that seriously. That’s why we recommend Real Estate Agents I Trust. We work with only the best agents in every market. We do our homework, talking to every agent before inviting them to join our network – and here’s a big one: we only work with full-time professionals…no part-time or inexperienced agents. Our team makes the introduction, and then follows you through the buying or selling process to make sure that you’re satisfied. The agents we work with have long track records, and are the best sellers in their field. They’re a part of this audience; they share your values, and they’re almost anywhere you want to go! The process is simple: just go to https://RealEstateAgentsITrust.com today and provide us with some basic info. Our team will contact you to make an introduction to our preferred agent in your town. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Former Japan PM Assassinated | Daily Best of July 8 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has died at age 67 after being shot during a speech on Friday in Nara, Japan, doctors who were treating him have confirmed. Birmingham, Alabama celebrated the opening ceremonies of the World Games last night. Macy Gray backpedals and apologizes for her common sense opinions about what it means to be a woman. And, a new telescope gives us a look at the vastness of space and God. item.title: Bye-Bye, Boris | Daily Best of July 7 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson announces his decision to step down due to heavy pressure from lawmakers in his own party. USC and UCLA announce plans to join the Big Ten. Aaron Rodgers got a weird tattoo. Elon Musk had secret twins who were born around the same time that Grimes gave birth to another one of his children. And the Georgia Guidestones were blown up in the middle of the night.. item.title: We're Back! 4th of July Vacation Recap | Daily Best of July 6 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Freedom, fun, and fireworks don't always mix. We take a look at a couple backyard fireworks shows that didn't go as planned, and we give you the recap of our time off. In politics, the Biden administration is having a hard time ignoring inflation and Hunter Biden's laptop, but that doesn't stop officials from trying. And sadly, a horrific mass shooting at a Highland Park, Illinois, parade leaves seven dead and a community in mourning. item.title: Roe v. Wade Overturned While We Are Live on Air | Daily Best of June 24 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We react live on the air as news breaks of the Supreme Court decision to overturn Roe v. Wade. Joe Biden accidentally shows us his cue cards, and the childlike instructions are shocking. Dr. Fauci tells people to continue wearing masks indoors. Biden takes his mask off to shout celebrations of vaccinating children. And in sports, Arch Manning announces his plans to play football at the University of Texas. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Guest: '2,000 Mules' Data Analyst Greg Phillips | Daily Best of June 23 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Greg Phillips has analyzed and provided data for the U.S. government and many large corporations and is one of the main data analysts behind the findings in "2,000 Mules." He sits down with us and explains how we've all basically bugged ourselves by carrying around cellphones. In other news, Biden and his entire administration have no idea how to tackle inflation and high gas prices. A real dog breed wins "Best In Show." And, Rick finally tracks down his college diploma, proving he did, in fact, graduate ... or is that a typo we see? Greg Phillips has analyzed and provided data for the U.S. government and many large corporations and is one of the main data analysts behind the findings in "2,000 Mules." He sits down with us and explains how we've all basically bugged ourselves by carrying around cellphones. In other news, Biden and his entire administration have no idea how to tackle inflation and high gas prices. A real dog breed wins "Best In Show." And, Rick finally tracks down his college diploma, proving he did, in fact, graduate ... or is that a typo we see?

item.title: 50 Years of Female Sports: Title IX & Trans Athletes | Daily Best of June 22 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Senator Tommy Tuberville joins us on the 50th anniversary of Title IX to discuss the success of the program that saw the participation rate of female student athletes rise from 3% to 50%. Senator Tuberville is now trying to stop trans athletes as they threaten the very existence of female sports. In other news, The World Games 2022 are just days away as Birmingham finalizes preparations as it hosts the huge international event. John Daly weighs in on Bill Clinton's golf game. And, country music superstar Randy Owen calls the show before he's had his morning coffee. item.title: Juneteenth & Maverick Monday | Daily Best of June 20 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We celebrate freedom and the fact that the United States no longer practices slavery, but allows for the people to work to achieve their maximum potential. Juneteenth should not be about trying to vilify the U.S. for once having slaves. Instead, celebrate because we are a free country. In other news, it's Maverick Monday. We gave you fair warning and enough time to see "Top Gun: Maverick," and now it's time for the reviews (spoiler alert!). Also, President Biden fell off a bicycle. Sponsor: Birch Gold - Inflation is already running hot…right at the highs of the last couple decades. And now the Dems are pushing through ANOTHER MASSIVE SPENDING PLAN! 3.5 trillion dollars! So here’s the deal… if you think money grows on trees, like our government does, then just keep living in ignorance. If you’re freaked out about the impact this additional spending is going to have on already high inflation, then protect your savings…NOW! Diversify your savings into physical Gold and Silver with Birch Gold Group. Birch Gold Group is the company that we recommend for precious metals. They have an A+ rating with the Better Business Bureau, countless 5-star reviews and THOUSANDS of satisfied customers. And they can help YOU protect your hard-earned savings. Thanks to a little-known section of IRS Tax Code, you can legally move your I-R-A or 401(k) into precious metals – with no tax implications or penalties. To get started on protecting your savings with gold in a TAX SHLETERED account, request a free info kit from Birch Gold by texting the word "RICKBUBBA" to 9-8-9-8-9-8. This comprehensive, 20-page kit reveals how gold and silver can protect your savings, and how you can move your I-R-A or 401(k) out of volatile stocks and bonds and into a Precious Metals IRA. Text "RICKBUBBA" to the number 9-8-9-8-9-8. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Close to Home: St. Stephen's Church Shooting | Daily Best of June 17 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: A shooting at St. Stephen's Church, which is about 10 minutes from our studio, has left two dead and a gunman in custody. The initial reports say the gunman previously attended the church and opened fire at a "Boomer's Potluck" event hosted by the church. In other news, Trump accurately predicted every catastrophe should Biden be elected. Father's Day is this weekend, so we run down our favorite Father's Day gifts. Why are thousands of cattle dropping dead in Kansas? And speaking of dropping dead, Biden attempts to offer condolences and it doesn't go great. Learn more about your ad choices. Meanwhile, mainstream media continues to slowly back away from the Biden dumpster fire. item.description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre tries to dismiss and laugh off Don Lemon when she is asked about Biden's failing mental and physical health. item.content:encoded:
White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre tries to dismiss and laugh off Don Lemon when she is asked about Biden's failing mental and physical health. The lady doth protest too much, wethinks. In other news, Yellowstone is facing major closures as roads and cabins are washed away in floods. An elephant stomps a woman to death, then crashes her funeral to stomp some more. Amber Heard breaks her silence since losing her recent defamation trial. And, Jack Del Rio is fined by the NFL for calling January 6 a "dust-up."

item.description: Matthew McConaughey weighs in on the gun control debate by advocating for gun responsibility and not allowing the 2nd Amendment to be abused by deranged individuals. ESPN commentator Sarah Spain calls Tampa Bay Rays players bigoted for not wanting to wear rainbow logos. A huge orangutan grabs a man through the bars at an Indonesian zoo and the man barely escapes. Pro-abortion protestors crash a WNBA game causing delays for tens of fans in the audience. Todd and Julie Chrisley, stars of "Chrisley Knows Best," are found guilty of bank fraud and tax evasion. item.content:encoded:
Matthew McConaughey weighs in on the gun control debate by advocating for gun responsibility and not allowing the 2nd Amendment to be abused by deranged individuals. ESPN commentator Sarah Spain calls Tampa Bay Rays players bigoted for not wanting to wear rainbow logos. A huge orangutan grabs a man through the bars at an Indonesian zoo and the man barely escapes. Pro-abortion protestors crash a WNBA game causing delays for tens of fans in the audience. Todd and Julie Chrisley, stars of "Chrisley Knows Best," are found guilty of bank fraud and tax evasion. And lastly, we give away over $5,000 to Mercy Deliverance Ministries & Food Bank courtesy of Buffalo Wild Wings!

item.title: Not Helping Your Cause: Abortion Activists Strip In Church | Daily Best of June 7 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: While we don't think Joel Osteen is the most biblically-accurate preacher around, we know abortion activists aren't helping their cause when they stripped down and screamed cuss words in the middle of a church service. In other news, Jurassic World: how many times are y'all gonna let the dinosaurs escape? In sports, Aaron Donald gets a huge NFL contract extension and the Saudis are laying down huge stacks of cash to try to attract big-time golf talent. And lastly, let's play 21 Questions with Rick & Bubba! item.title: Remembering D-Day | Daily Best of June 6 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Today we remember June 6, 1944: The World War II D-Day invasion of Normandy, France. We honor the heroism of those involved in the largest seaborne invasion in history. Listen to FDR and notice how much the democrat president invokes the name of God and the importance of preserving our republic and our religion. How times have changed. In other news, Garth Brooks came to Birmingham and sold out the first concert held at the new 40,000 seat capacity Protective Stadium. And lastly, we watch crazy Brits chase a wheel of cheese down a very steep hill. Sponsor: Ladder is revolutionizing an age-old industry offering term life insurance at a personalized price, that can flex as your needs change. Why not pay a bit each month to protect the ones you love? Ladder makes it impressively fast and easy to get covered. You just need a few minutes, and a phone or laptop to apply. Ladder’s smart algorithms work in real-time, so you’ll find out instantly if you’re approved. No hidden fees. Cancel any time. At Ladder, they've created a painless way to get the life insurance coverage you need for those you care about most. Check out Ladder today to see if you’re instantly approved. Go to https://ladderlife.com/bubba. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: 'The View' Calls for Abolishing Republicans | Daily Best of June 3 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: The geniuses at "The View" call for the abolishment of Republicans. Do they realize that's approximately half of the population? Jim Jordan calls out Democrats for their efforts to attain more power disguised as a desire to stop mass shootings. It's National Donut Day, and tailgaters outside the studio bring donuts for us by the dozen. And meteorologist James Spann tweets out a picture of an unfortunately shaped cloud. item.title: Speedy's Son's Wedding & Canada's Gun Freeze | Daily Best of May 31 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Speedy's son Tyler got married this weekend and the whole gang made it out for the big day! The cops were called, the power went out and Adler's baby screamed, "Sucker!" In other news, Justin Trudeau announces legislation to 'freeze' handgun sales, imports and transfers across Canada, and Joe Biden suggests he wants to ban 'high caliber' weapons like 9mm handguns. If we look back in history, how did things go for the general population after the government became the only lawful owners of guns? (Not good.)

item.title: Monkeypox Fear-Mongering | Daily Best of May 26 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: The incredibly low risks of Monkeypox do not match the hysteria seen across mainstream media. Why all the fear-mongering? Speaking of monkeys, we argue over who is the smartest animal. MSNBC can't stop saying Trump during their primary election coverage. Do they know he didn't run? Beto O'Rourke disgustingly grandstands and confronts Texas Gov. Greg Abbott during press conference. And lastly, a rat in NYC stumbles into the wrong park... a dog park. item.title: Biden Balks & Speedy Barks | Daily Best of May 24 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Once again, Joe Biden goes off script and the Biden administration has to walk back the president's pledge to respond militarily if China invades Taiwan. Speedy barks loudly at his son Reese's high school graduation ceremony. Whoopi Goldberg does not understand the purpose of communion. NYC tears down the last remaining phone booth. And lastly, a United Airlines employee picks a fight with the wrong guy.
Sponsor: Birch Gold - Inflation is already running hot…right at the highs of the last couple decades. And now the Dems are pushing through ANOTHER MASSIVE SPENDING PLAN! 3.5 trillion dollars! So here’s the deal… if you think money grows on trees, like our government does, then just keep living in ignorance. If you’re freaked out about the impact this additional spending is going to have on already high inflation, then protect your savings…NOW! Diversify your savings into physical Gold and Silver with Birch Gold Group. Birch Gold Group is the company that we recommend for precious metals. They have an A+ rating with the Better Business Bureau, countless 5-star reviews and THOUSANDS of satisfied customers. And they can help YOU protect your hard-earned savings. Thanks to a little-known section of IRS Tax Code, you can legally move your I-R-A or 401(k) into precious metals – with no tax implications or penalties. To get started on protecting your savings with gold in a TAX SHLETERED account, request a free info kit from Birch Gold by texting the word "RICKBUBBA" to 9-8-9-8-9-8. This comprehensive, 20-page kit reveals how gold and silver can protect your savings, and how you can move your I-R-A or 401(k) out of volatile stocks and bonds and into a Precious Metals IRA. Text RICKBUBBA" to the number 9-8-9-8-9-8. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Dead Birds & Monkeypox | Daily Best of May 23 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Monkeypox cases rise across the globe and we are wondering when the lockdowns and mandatory vaccines will start. Rick gives Speedy and his wife a tour of his farm house and they find a surprise waiting for them... It's not a good surprise. Ron DeSantis breaks down the Biden administrations intentional failures on every level of their energy policy. Bill Maher once again brings common sense questions like, why is the LGBTQ+ community doubling in size every generation? And lastly, the Pfizer CEO really creeps us out.

item.title: Dinesh D'Souza Is Our Guest, so This Is Probably Blocked | Daily Best of May 20 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Election fraud is the most censored subject in America today. Dinesh D'Souza joins us to discuss the reaction to his latest project, "2000 Mules." Last time we had him on, we were flagged with warning labels all across our social media, so don't be surprised if the only place you can find this is BlazeTV. In other news, the college football world is reeling in the aftermath of Nick Saban speaking out against Jimbo Fisher and Texas A&M. And lastly, why is the price of gas so high? Joe Biden's answer: Joe Biden. item.title: Flashback to 25 Years Ago: Khaled Gains U.S. Citizenship | Daily Best of May 17 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We are visited by an old friend of the show, Khaled, aka Killi Vanilli, who Rick & Bubba helped gain U.S. citizenship over 25 years ago. Bill Gates reassures us that vaccine boosters will only be needed every 6 months... or less. A raccoon gets loose at an Arkansas baseball game. And lastly, we agree with Elon Musk when he says the teleprompter is controlling Joe Biden. item.title: Black Holes & Bad Calls | Daily Best of May 13 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Rick is off today to see his son graduate from college. Speedy has some words for a baseball umpire that botched a call at a college baseball game. A black hole has been discovered at the center of the Milky Way galaxy and the vastness of space points to a Creator God. Elon Musk makes some good points about the strengths and weaknesses of Donald Trump. And lastly, and most importantly, will Top Gun 2 live up to the hype?! Sponsor: RealEstateAgentsITrust.com Buying or selling a home is already one of the most stressful things you can do – and it can be ten times worse if you’re not working with the right agent. Generally speaking, our homes are our biggest investment – that’s a lot of responsibility, and you need an agent who can take that seriously. That’s why we recommend Real Estate Agents I Trust. We work with only the best agents in every market. We do our homework, talking to every agent before inviting them to join our network – and here’s a big one: we only work with full-time professionals…no part-time or inexperienced agents. Our team makes the introduction, and then follows you through the buying or selling process to make sure that you’re satisfied. The agents we work with have long track records, and are the best sellers in their field. They’re a part of this audience; they share your values, and they’re almost anywhere you want to go! The process is simple: just go to https://RealEstateAgentsITrust.com today and provide us with some basic info. Our team will contact you to make an introduction to our preferred agent in your town. item.title: 2000 Mules & Mother's Day | Daily Best of May 9 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Over the weekend we celebrated Mother's Day with our families, which always brings a story or two. Plus, we screened the latest documentary by Dinesh D'Souza "2000 Mules" which details the coordinated ballot harvesting during the 2020 election. And, Rich Strike, a 80-1 long shot wins the Kentucky Derby. Sponsor: Moink delivers grass-fed and grass-finished beef and lamb, pastured pork and chicken, and wild-caught Alaskan salmon, direct to your door - helping Family Farms become financially independent outside of big agriculture.Their animals are raised outdoors, their fish swim wild in the ocean, and Moink meat is free of antibiotics, hormones, sugar, and all the other junk you find pre-packaged in the meat aisle. item.title: Biden's Lie And Truth About Abortion | Daily Best of May 4 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Joe Biden lies when he says most religions do not have a stance on when life begins, then Biden tells the truth when he says abort a "child." We thought pro-abortion folks claim it's just part of a "birthing person's" body? Biden visits Alabama and incorrectly says we sent javelin missiles to Russia. Comedian Dave Chappelle gets tackled while on stage. And lastly, we love donuts and hate "May the Fourth" be with you. Sponsors: Home Title Lock: Everything is stored online these days - including your home's title information. Domestic and international cyber-thieves target U.S. homeowners equity in their homes. Removing you from your home's title takes just minutes. Then they forge their name on the title document and refile it. Next, they take out loans using your home's equity and stick you with the payments. You likely won't know until you get a late payment or foreclosure notice from several banks. Identity theft programs, banks, and homeowner insurance policies DON'T protect you. For pennies a day, Home Title Lock posts a virtual perimeter around your home's online title and mortgage information. https://HomeTitleLock.com

item.content:encoded:
Joe Biden lies when he says most religions do not have a stance on when life begins, then Biden tells the truth when he says abort a "child." We thought pro-abortion folks claim it's just part of a "birthing person's" body? Biden visits Alabama and incorrectly says we sent javelin missiles to Russia. Comedian Dave Chappelle gets tackled while on stage. And lastly, we love donuts and hate "May the Fourth" be with you.

Sponsors:

Home Title Lock: Everything is stored online these days - including your home's title information. Domestic and international cyber-thieves target U.S. homeowners equity in their homes. Removing you from your home's title takes just minutes. Then they forge their name on the title document and refile it. Next, they take out loans using your home's equity and stick you with the payments. You likely won't know until you get a late payment or foreclosure notice from several banks. Identity theft programs, banks, and homeowner insurance policies DON'T protect you. For pennies a day, Home Title Lock posts a virtual perimeter around your home's online title and mortgage information. https://HomeTitleLock.com

Celebs and politicians play dress up at the Met Gala while "the help" all still wear masks. item.title: Rick Gets Hooked, Biden Gets Cooked | Daily Best of May 2 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Rick hooks a fish, but then the fish hooks Rick! Trevor Noah headlines the White House Correspondents' Dinner, and Biden laughs because "gas is up, rent is up, food is up!" How hilarious. We look at unbelievable footage of a destructive tornado going through Andover, Kansas. Wynonna and Ashley Judd accepted an award on behalf of their late mother Naomi Judd, who passed away one day before her induction into the Country Music Hall of Fame. And Producer Adler recaps his trip to the IndyCar Grand Prix of Alabama with his family. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Who Fact Checks The Disinformation Board? | Daily Best of April 29 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: The Biden Administration announced plans for a “Disinformation Governance Board” which will be headed by Nina Jankowicz, who claimed Hunter Biden's laptop was fake news and supported the Steele dossier as fact. In one of the worst examples yet, Joe Biden struggles to speak as he asks Congress for $33 billion to support Ukraine. Sean Hannity says he misses Rick & Bubba. Speedy thinks he's going to be attacked by a man with nunchucks, and Rick almost lights a chipmunk on fire. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Biden's Bulb Ban & Conservative Follower Counts Climb | Daily Best of April 27 | Rick & Bubba
item.description:
Joe Biden's Energy Department bans incandescent lightbulbs forcing consumers to buy LED, which can cost 4 times as much. Conservatives on Twitter see their follower counts spike as Elon Musk is set to take the reigns of the social media platform. Why is this happening and who is behind it? And we gear up for the World Games coming to Birmingham by shooting arrows in the parking lot near a busy road... maybe not our best idea.
Rick & Bubba Rundown
<playbook@blazemedia.com> "Cindy Kehler" <ckehler@blazemedia.com> Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.description: It looks like Elon's bid to buy Twitter for $43 billion will actually go through. What does this mean for free speech on the platform and why is the Left fighting it? We can't help but watch CNN and MSNBC lose there minds over the social media platform going private. Speaking of privates, Hunter Biden's laptop continues to be a topic the White House simply won't comment on. Rick finds out his life insurance hasn't been valid for over 20 years. And comedian John Crist gets into a taxi with no driver. Sponsor: Home Title Lock: Everything is stored online these days - including your home's title information. Domestic and international cyber-thieves target U.S. homeowners equity in their homes. Removing you from your home's title takes just minutes. Then they forge their name on the title document and refile it. Next, they take out loans using your home's equity and stick you with the payments. You likely won't know until you get a late payment or foreclosure notice from several banks. Identity theft programs, banks, and homeowner insurance policies DON'T protect you. For pennies a day, Home Title Lock posts a virtual perimeter around your home's online title and mortgage information. https://HomeTitleLock.com Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: 3 Wrecks: Wow, What a Weekend! | Daily Best of April 25 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: We recap three wrecks that happened this weekend: one during the big finish at the NASCAR races at Talladega, another when Bubba wrecked his ATV leaving him stranded in the woods, and lastly, when Joe Biden promised to spend billions to make every U.S. military vehicle climate friendly. Donald Trump sounds off on Prince Harry. Elon Musk fires hilarious shots at Bill Gates. And, a Baker Mayfield statue is revealed that looks nothing like Baker Mayfield. item.title: More Like CNN MINUS! | Daily Best of April 22 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: CNN spends hundreds of millions of dollars launching their CNN+ streaming service only to have very low subscriber numbers forcing CNN to dismantle the whole operation after one month. Mike Tyson beats up a man after the drunk passenger won't stop bothering the boxing legend on an airplane. A bride and wedding caterer are arrested after allegedly sneaking weed into the food at the reception sending many guests to the hospital. And speaking of weed, we debate the best combo of milk and cookies. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Netflix Tanks and Mike Tyson Tokes | Daily Best of April 20 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Netflix shares plunge as the company announces a decline in subscriptions for the first time in a decade. Mike Tyson celebrates "4/20" by going on Joe Rogan's podcast, smoking weed, then claiming rich people hunt the homeless for sport. Biden and his administration flip and flop and flip and flop on the recent changes to airline mask mandates. Shaq admits he is the reason his marriage fell apart and shows that the material things of Earth will never fully satisfy. Helms celebrates his son and daughter winning the Alabama 7A Tennis State Championship. And Speedy and Greg compete in a tire change challenge as we gear up for The Honda IndyCar Grand Prix coming to Birmingham. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Mask On, Mask Off | Daily Best of April 19 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Passengers, pilots, and flight attendants cheer after the end of the federal mask mandate is announced, but the Biden administration is pushing for two more weeks of masking. Two weeks... where have we heard that before? Things have gotten so bad at the White House even the Easter Bunny is having to help struggling Joe Biden. In Shanghai 26 million people are still locked down even though 90% are vaccinated. And, Producer Adler's car breaks down and he tells the story of walking along a busy highway with a birthday cake in his hands, the police showing up, and accidentally burning himself with oil. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Tax Day: If 10% Is Good Enough For Jesus... | Daily Best of April 18
item.description:
Tax Day: If 10% Is Good Enough For Jesus... | Daily Best of April 18 | Rick & Bubba
It's tax day 2022 and if 10% is good enough for Jesus, it ought to be enough for Uncle Sam. We give a $100 to the person who calls in with the largest tax debt. The legendary bluegrass band, "Three On A String" performs live in studio. We recap Easter, the debut of the USFL, and Bananaball in Birmingham last weekend. Plus, Tim Tebow joins to discuss his gig as Grand Marshall of the upcoming Honda Indy Grand Prix. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

In other news, we look at the inspiring story of a race car driver who was blinded in an accident 10 years ago, but just broke a Guinness World Record by driving a customized car at a speed of 211 mph. item.title: Teachers Get A Raise & We're Taking Off Mondays | Daily Best of April 12 | Rick & Bubba
item.description: Teachers across Alabama are set to get a big raise. Will it fix the teacher shortage and will it be sustainable? A proposed California bill would change the definition of a workweek from 40 hours to 32 hours. So are we taking off Friday or Monday? We recap the CMT Awards, or the CMAs, or maybe it's the ACMs... we can't tell the difference. And lastly, Greg tells a story about going to a carnival as a kid and seeing the world's smallest man.
